body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
A summary of reviews will appear here.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#25573](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25573) ([POC] guix: produce a fully -static-pie x86_64 bitcoind using GCC and glibc by fanquake)
* [#24123](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24123) (build: Pointer Authentication and Branch Target Identification for aarch64 Linux (Guix) by fanquake)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

diff_hunk:
@@ -15,15 +15,15 @@
 
 import lief #type:ignore
 
-# Debian 9 (Stretch) EOL: 2022. https://wiki.debian.org/DebianReleases#Production_Releases
+# Debian 10 (Buster) EOL: 2024. https://wiki.debian.org/LTS
 #
-# - g++ version 6.3.0 (https://packages.debian.org/search?suite=stretch&arch=any&searchon=names&keywords=g%2B%2B)
-# - libc version 2.24 (https://packages.debian.org/search?suite=stretch&arch=any&searchon=names&keywords=libc6)
+# - g++ version 8.3.0 (https://packages.debian.org/search?suite=stretch&arch=any&searchon=names&keywords=g%2B%2B)

body: why is g++ mentioned here at all? Isn't this about glibc, a run-time dependency, whereas g++ is a compile time dependency?

body:
For reference, this would affect less than 2% of snap users:

![stats_feb2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6399679/216395929-61d1aa71-2b1f-4320-9a18-6e03d5fc2ad4.png)

body:
>This would drop support for Ubuntu Xenial (16.04) & Debian Stretch (9).

Only for the binaries, right? Building from source should still be possible, I'd expect. (Though I'm not sure if we care, it might be good to clarify in the description)
